description: If you’re trying to gradually introduce someone to the complex flavors found in&nbsp;absinthe and SUZE, then order a La Tour Eiffel. The strong yet elegant aromas are present in small quantities served on an innocent looking champagne flute that won't overpower your guest's taste buds!
name: La Tour Eiffel

recipeInstructions.name: Rinse the inside of a chilled champagne flute with absinthe.
recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the inside of a chilled champagne flute with absinthe.

recipeInstructions.name: Add some ice cubes to the flute and set aside.
recipeInstructions.text: Add some ice cubes to the flute and set aside.

recipeInstructions.name: Pour the cognac, Cointreau, and Suze in an ice-filled mixing glass.
recipeInstructions.text: Pour the cognac, Cointreau, and Suze in an ice-filled mixing glass.

recipeInstructions.name: Remove the ice and excess absinthe from the Champagne flute, then strain the drink into it.
recipeInstructions.text: Remove the ice and excess absinthe from the Champagne flute, then strain the drink into it.
